content: I've been playing around with the online demo https://leanprover-community.github.io/lean-web-editor/ however any attempt to use Real or form a set of reals has failed me with the error unknown identifier 'Real' or any other spelling including \mathbb{R} and i could not find a way to import reals.
That editor is for Lean 3, you probably want to use https://lean.math.hhu.de/ instead

I was under the impression that it was the latest version as it is linked from various pages. This is as far as i get:

import Mathlib.Data.Real.Basic -- hopefully imports the right thing
structure isosystem (T: set Real)

the error is: 

type expected, got
  (set ℝ : ?m.5 PUnit)

Lean 4 is still in prerelease and mathlib is in the process of being ported so a lot of the material on various webpages refers to Lean 3.
set is capitalized in Lean 4 so you should have Set Real
Thanks ... the error message was not exactly helpful.
Joh-Tob Schäg has marked this topic as resolved.
Hmm, this is because set is in the global namespace, from docs4#MonadStateOf.set

I was under the impression that it was the latest version as it is linked from various pages.

There are separate latest versions of Lean 3 and Lean 4. Neither is fully superior to the other yet. Notably Lean4 is missing half of it's math library

The error isn't that much more informative if this weren't the case because of autoimplicits.

function expected at
  set
term has type
  ?m.77614
Based on your interests in #general > Control theory for LTI systems, you would do much better to start with Lean 3.
